00002 /* Eigen decomposition code for symmetric 3x3 matrices, copied from the public
00003 domain Java Matrix library JAMA. */
00004 
00005 #include <math.h>
00006 
00007 #ifdef MAX
00008 #undef MAX
00009 #endif
00010 
00011 #define MAX(a, b) ((a)>(b)?(a):(b))
00012 
00013 #define n 3
00014 
00015 static double hypot2(double x, double y) {
00016   return sqrt(x*x+y*y);
00017 }
00018 
00020 static void tred2(double V[n][n], double d[n], double e[n]) {
00021   
00022   //  This is derived from the Algol procedures tred2 by
00023   //  Bowdler, Martin, Reinsch, and Wilkinson, Handbook for
00024   //  Auto. Comp., Vol.ii-Linear Algebra, and the corresponding
00025   //  Fortran subroutine in EISPACK.
00026   
00027   for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
00028     d[j] = V[n-1][j];
00029   }
00030   
00031   // Householder reduction to tridiagonal form.
00032   
00033   for (int i = n-1; i > 0; i--) {
00034     
00035     // Scale to avoid under/overflow.
00036     
00037     double scale = 0.0;
00038     double h = 0.0;
00039     for (int k = 0; k < i; k++) {
00040       scale = scale + fabs(d[k]);
00041     }
00042     if (scale == 0.0) {
00043       e[i] = d[i-1];
00044       for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
00045         d[j] = V[i-1][j];
00046         V[i][j] = 0.0;
00047         V[j][i] = 0.0;
00048       }
00049     } else {
00050       
00051       // Generate Householder vector.
00052       
00053       for (int k = 0; k < i; k++) {
00054         d[k] /= scale;
00055         h += d[k] * d[k];
00056       }
00057       double f = d[i-1];
00058       double g = sqrt(h);
00059       if (f > 0) {
00060         g = -g;
00061       }
00062       e[i] = scale * g;
00063       h = h - f * g;
00064       d[i-1] = f - g;
00065       for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
00066         e[j] = 0.0;
00067       }
00068       
00069       // Apply similarity transformation to remaining columns.
00070       
00071       for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
00072         f = d[j];
00073         V[j][i] = f;
00074         g = e[j] + V[j][j] * f;
00075         for (int k = j+1; k <= i-1; k++) {
00076           g += V[k][j] * d[k];
00077           e[k] += V[k][j] * f;
00078         }
00079         e[j] = g;
00080       }
00081       f = 0.0;
00082       for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
00083         e[j] /= h;
00084         f += e[j] * d[j];
00085       }
00086       double hh = f / (h + h);
00087       for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
00088         e[j] -= hh * d[j];
00089       }
00090       for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
00091         f = d[j];
00092         g = e[j];
00093         for (int k = j; k <= i-1; k++) {
00094           V[k][j] -= (f * e[k] + g * d[k]);
00095         }
00096         d[j] = V[i-1][j];
00097         V[i][j] = 0.0;
00098       }
00099     }
00100     d[i] = h;
00101   }
00102   
00103   // Accumulate transformations.
00104   
00105   for (int i = 0; i < n-1; i++) {
00106     V[n-1][i] = V[i][i];
00107     V[i][i] = 1.0;
00108     double h = d[i+1];
00109     if (h != 0.0) {
00110       for (int k = 0; k <= i; k++) {
00111         d[k] = V[k][i+1] / h;
00112       }
00113       for (int j = 0; j <= i; j++) {
00114         double g = 0.0;
00115         for (int k = 0; k <= i; k++) {
00116           g += V[k][i+1] * V[k][j];
00117         }
00118         for (int k = 0; k <= i; k++) {
00119           V[k][j] -= g * d[k];
00120         }
00121       }
00122     }
00123     for (int k = 0; k <= i; k++) {
00124       V[k][i+1] = 0.0;
00125     }
00126   }
00127   for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
00128     d[j] = V[n-1][j];
00129     V[n-1][j] = 0.0;
00130   }
00131   V[n-1][n-1] = 1.0;
00132   e[0] = 0.0;
00133 } 
00134 
00136 static void tql2(double V[n][n], double d[n], double e[n]) {
00137   
00138   //  This is derived from the Algol procedures tql2, by
00139   //  Bowdler, Martin, Reinsch, and Wilkinson, Handbook for
00140   //  Auto. Comp., Vol.ii-Linear Algebra, and the corresponding
00141   //  Fortran subroutine in EISPACK.
00142   
00143   for (int i = 1; i < n; i++) {
00144     e[i-1] = e[i];
00145   }
00146   e[n-1] = 0.0;
00147   
00148   double f = 0.0;
00149   double tst1 = 0.0;
00150   double eps = pow(2.0,-52.0);
00151   for (int l = 0; l < n; l++) {
00152     
00153     // Find small subdiagonal element
00154     
00155     tst1 = MAX(tst1,fabs(d[l]) + fabs(e[l]));
00156     int m = l;
00157     while (m < n) {
00158       if (fabs(e[m]) <= eps*tst1) {
00159         break;
00160       }
00161       m++;
00162     }
00163     
00164     // If m == l, d[l] is an eigenvalue,
00165     // otherwise, iterate.
00166     
00167     if (m > l) {
00168       int iter = 0;
00169       do {
00170         iter = iter + 1;  // (Could check iteration count here.)
00171         
00172         // Compute implicit shift
00173         
00174         double g = d[l];
00175         double p = (d[l+1] - g) / (2.0 * e[l]);
00176         double r = hypot2(p,1.0);
00177         if (p < 0) {
00178           r = -r;
00179         }
00180         d[l] = e[l] / (p + r);
00181         d[l+1] = e[l] * (p + r);
00182         double dl1 = d[l+1];
00183         double h = g - d[l];
00184         for (int i = l+2; i < n; i++) {
00185           d[i] -= h;
00186         }
00187         f = f + h;
00188         
00189         // Implicit QL transformation.
00190         
00191         p = d[m];
00192         double c = 1.0;
00193         double c2 = c;
00194         double c3 = c;
00195         double el1 = e[l+1];
00196         double s = 0.0;
00197         double s2 = 0.0;
00198         for (int i = m-1; i >= l; i--) {
00199           c3 = c2;
00200           c2 = c;
00201           s2 = s;
00202           g = c * e[i];
00203           h = c * p;
00204           r = hypot2(p,e[i]);
00205           e[i+1] = s * r;
00206           s = e[i] / r;
00207           c = p / r;
00208           p = c * d[i] - s * g;
00209           d[i+1] = h + s * (c * g + s * d[i]);
00210           
00211           // Accumulate transformation.
00212           
00213           for (int k = 0; k < n; k++) {
00214             h = V[k][i+1];
00215             V[k][i+1] = s * V[k][i] + c * h;
00216             V[k][i] = c * V[k][i] - s * h;
00217           }
00218         }
00219         p = -s * s2 * c3 * el1 * e[l] / dl1;
00220         e[l] = s * p;
00221         d[l] = c * p;
00222         
00223         // Check for convergence.
00224         
00225       } while (fabs(e[l]) > eps*tst1);
00226     }
00227     d[l] = d[l] + f;
00228     e[l] = 0.0;
00229   }
00230   
00231   // Sort eigenvalues and corresponding vectors.
00232   
00233   for (int i = 0; i < n-1; i++) {
00234     int k = i;
00235     double p = d[i];
00236     for (int j = i+1; j < n; j++) {
00237       if (d[j] < p) {
00238         k = j;
00239         p = d[j];
00240       }
00241     }
00242     if (k != i) {
00243       d[k] = d[i];
00244       d[i] = p;
00245       for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
00246         p = V[j][i];
00247         V[j][i] = V[j][k];
00248         V[j][k] = p;
00249       }
00250     }
00251   }
00252 }
00253 
00254 void eigen_decomposition(double A[n][n], double V[n][n], double d[n]) {
00255   double e[n];
00256   for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
00257     for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
00258       V[i][j] = A[i][j];
00259     }
00260   }
00261   tred2(V, d, e);
00262   tql2(V, d, e);
00263 }
